conclusion: Determine the electric field between the plates of a parallel-plate capacitor.
Electric field E between plates is given by E = V/d.
Capacitance C is defined as C = Q/V, so V = Q/C.
Substitute V = Q/C into E = V/d to get E = Q/(Cd).
Force F on a point charge q in an electric field E is given by F = qE.
Substitute E = Q/(Cd) into F = qE to get F = q(Q/(Cd)).
Simplify F = q(Q/(Cd)) to F = qQ/(Cd).
The magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q is qQ/(Cd).
